|website = [http://www.psoe.es/ http://www.psoe.es/] }} The 'Spanish Socialist
Workers' Party' ( , 'PSOE' ) is a social-democratic political party in Spain. Its political
position is Centre-left. The PSOE is the former ruling party of Spain, until
beaten in the elections of November 2011 and the second oldest, exceeded only by
the Partido Carlista, founded in 1833.

The PSOE has had strong ties with the General Union of Workers (UGT), a Spanish
trade union. For decades, UGT membership was a requirement for PSOE membership.
During the 1980s, though, UGT criticised the economic policies of the PSOE, even
calling for a general strike on December 14, 1988.

The PSOE recently lost the general elections on 20 November 2011. The PSOE is a
full member of the Party of European Socialists and the Socialist
International. In the European Parliament, the PSOE's
21 MEPs sit in the Socialists and Democrats European parliamentary group.
